top_categories.workout_context: Spring Valley 100 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Spring Valley 100. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 100 miles, Spring Valley 100 punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Spring Valley 100 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Spring Valley 100’s minnesota rolling, local event demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Every session at Spring Valley 100 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 100 miles, Spring Valley 100 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Spring Valley 100 — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
The varied gradients at Spring Valley 100 reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Racing Spring Valley 100 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Spring Valley 100. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on minnesota rolling gravel.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Spring Valley 100’s minnesota rolling gravel delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Spring Valley 100’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Spring Valley 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on minnesota rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: minnesota rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, G Spot, and Durability to prepare you for 100 miles of minnesota rolling gravel in Spring Valley, Minnesota.
